Winter break is coming up soon! If you are like me you have already spent too much money this season so I thought I would share some FREE ideas to bond with family and build lasting memories.

1.Make a gingerbread house - the kids will love eating it and if you make it from scratch, your house will smell amazing!

2. Take a walk or drive to tour the holiday lights nearby.

3. DIY birdfeeder. Let the kiddos find a pine cone. Lather it in peanut butter and roll it in birdseed. Hang it outside the window and sit back and watch!

4. Go caroling at a local nursing home. This will bless the elderly and the kids as well as they experience giving to others.

5. Make popcorn and candy garland and decorate the tree!

6. Night under the stars (or the lights on the Christmas tree!) Have a family slumber party and drag out the sleeping bags. Fall asleep to Christmas movies under the Christmas tree.

Our rising middle schoolers got treats from Havana Carolina Bakery this morning after hearing a book talk about our new middle school-wide summer reading book, Merci Suarez Changes Gears by Meg Medina!

This charming middle grade novel is the 2019 Newbery Medal winner, and it follows 6th grader Merci Suarez as she navigates middle school drama, her loving but ever-present family, and the typical struggles of growing up. Merci and her Cuban-American family spend a lot of time in her aunt's bakery throughout the book. Many different treats get talked about in the story, and students got to sample two of them today: the guava pastelitos and Cuban bread.

All 5th-7th grade students will get more information about their summer reading assignment in their end of year packets on Friday, including purchase links, several Cuban bakeries/restaurants in the Charlotte area, and more. We look forward to hearing all about how much our middle school families love Merci's story!
